intro: Impatiens punaensis, commonly known as the Andean impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes in South America. It is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink and red. The plant has heart-shaped, glossy leaves and thrives in cool, moist environments. It is often found in rocky areas and forest understories at elevations between 2,500 and 4,000 meters. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation efforts.
